title: "It's just" argument.
body:
Tired of people using the "It's just ARAM!" or "It's just Norms!" as a reason to troll or int. Am I seriously in the minority on this? If these people are ok  with trolling ARAM's and Norms, it's not going to stop them from doing it in ranked. Trying to have fun is fine and all, but there's nothing fun about building in a way that you do negative damage and essentially screw your team over because you feel like it.

I don't know, it's all so tiring boys. {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}} My resolve to play this game is fading fast.

replies.body: "its just a game" is a form of griefing since it is considered trolling.  it is known as "minimization," a form of trolling.

> [{quoted}](name=TimX24968B,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5E1AyotM,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-07-19T18:20:39.771+0000)
>
> "its just a game" is a form of griefing since it is considered trolling.  it is known as "minimization," a form of trolling.

I agree, but unfortunately this community will always prove it's ever toxic and not improving. Maybe next season.

I dont think the game will last to next season. Its already nosediving. Season 3 veterans like me have already left. I just came to watch the game burn and try and see if I can convince any survivors to leave the game.

Riot brought the dumpster-fire
I brought the marshmallows, chocolate, and graham crackers
Time to make s'mores and the game burn. 

They go out of their way to chase veteran players away in favor of the casual "4 fun" and "Esports edgelord" crowd. 
Rather than keeping a good game, they warped and distorted it to cater to streamer kids looking for thier "sick playz"
Game used to be a game of strategy and teamwork, working with your team to fight through towers to destroy the enemy nexus.
Now its bout competing against your own teammate to fight over who has "most kills,bruh" and who is "carrying this trash team, report inting plz" 

I uninstalled, and I try and get others to walk away from riot as well.

I definitely agree. The "it's just X" argument to me is more often than not just an excuse to not try as hard as one should or is used to try to excuse poor behavior. Another mindset I'm personally not a fan of is the "end fast" one, where people want to try to end games as fast as possible (often in 7 minutes) for various reasons, such as they have somewhere to be soon or they want to try to account level as fast as possible. As someone who plays primarily co-op vs. ai I rarely if ever have fun in these types of games since I just want to practice different things and/or just enjoy playing the game like normal in general.

Not sure what can be done about people with these types of mindsets but I definitely agree that they're more often than not detrimental if that makes sense.
"end fast" can be valid however, if you have an early game team comp, or if the enemy has a late game team comp.

> [{quoted}](name=TimX24968B,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5E1AyotM,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-07-21T18:45:09.371+0000)
>
> "end fast" can be valid however, if you have an early game team comp, or if the enemy has a late game team comp.

Perhaps, but more often than not I see it used by people who just want games to end at 7 minutes, with some of them getting upset if it doesn't happen.
agreed.  if you dont have at least an hour to commit to a game, don't start it.

What about the people who will go through the process to start a game, wait for the match to start (everyone gets into thier lane) and you read

... "I gotta Go" (usually school, appointment, etc)

The people who know they have to leave yet still que up anyways and wait for a game to start, then announce that they have to go. 
And they will often use "Chill, its just a game" when you get mad at them for starting a game only to leave 3-5 minutes in. 

On top of that the "Its just X" is usually an excuse for players to ignore/dismiss people who are trying to win. They will also commonly accuse you of being a "tryhard" for not going along with them.

Its like signing up for a baseball tournament, going to your spot, then telling people "Chill, its just a game. I just came here to have fun and toss the ball back and forth" when the rest of the team is trying to actually play a baseball game. 

Alot of these people ignore every objective aspect of the game and just try and treat it like any other TDM. They ignore objectives, they ignore towers, everything else except the "i got more kills than u" aspect. 
Then when you tell them that the point of the game is to destroy towers to get to the enemy nexus, they call you a "Tryhard" and tell you to "chill, its just a game. I came here to have fun, if you want to win you should go play another game"
"its just a game" is a form of trolling called "minimization", and many use it as an excuse to grief.  both of these are against riot ToS

Sometimes I say it’s just a game or it’s just norms if, for example, someone took phase rush on Vayne or something. Can’t change anything by getting angry and flaming. Doesn’t mean it’s not frustrating at times.
"I don't care about this mode as much as you do, therefore it's acceptable for me to annoy you. Which I will, because trolling is the actual game I'm playing."
Well, this happens when Rito assumes "it's just a bad game" for every soft inter. All they care about is to be nice to eachother in chat.

> [{quoted}](name=Aladoron,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5E1AyotM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-19T10:38:06.444+0000)
>
> Well, this happens when Rito assumes "it's just a bad game" for every soft inter. All they care about is to be nice to eachother in chat.

Pretty sure people troll regardless of a game companys policies. There are trolls in games that Riot has no part in.

Yes, it happens, i do not think i said othewise.

The thing is, when it goes mostly unpunished people tend to do it more.

> [{quoted}](name=Aladoron,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5E1AyotM,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-07-24T06:42:35.821+0000)
>
> Yes, it happens, i do not think i said othewise.
> 
> The thing is, when it goes mostly unpunished people tend to do it more.

Oh.. I just rarely ever see trolls in league, so I didnt make that connection.

> I just rarely ever see trolls in league

Good for you :D

Rather than have  a good game, they want us all to play nice and have a tea party. 

and yeah, sometimes trash talk is a means feeling out your team. 
I Kept saying it. If someone plays super passive and scared, the enemy will WALK ALL OVER THEM. Why? because they know you wont do anything to assert yourself.
And low and behold, these same people are the ones who expect everyone to never say a naughty word to anyone, and end up losing the lane because the moment the enemy takes a step in thier direction, they shit their drawers and go hide behind the tower. 
Then when you try and get them off your tower, these players will turn around and tell you how trash you are for trying to get the enmy to back off because "You win by staying behind tower and farming minions" while the enemy is busy ripping chunks out of the tower and wave-crashing minions into us.

But no, dont want anyone to feel slightly unpleasant or not-nice words because it might give them a yucky feeling in thier tumtum. 

There is a reason I refer to League players as Preschoolers, BECAUSE THEY ACT LIKE THEM. 
The moment the game doesnt completely cater to thier schedule, thier game plan. If you dont play who they want you to play, if you dont build what they TELL you to build. If you have a strategy they dont approve of. They will drop to the ground and start kicking and screaming because you are "trolling" (aka "ur not doing what I tell you to do, you wont build how -I- tell you to build)
Pretty sure the majority of people find trolling and inting in ARAMs to be "not cool". I havent seen one person ever say no its okay, its just an aram, aside from the rare people who do it.

there is no such thing that likes ""It's just" argument." here, just o let you know 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

while using the argument for real trolling/inting is bad and you still can report those anyway, its a great argument when players are trying things or memeing and i will use it each time i see case of harassment on those who try new stuff in normals/aram [srsly ppl need to stop flaming the 0 point players for losing to 3m yasuo main in mid]

I don't think you can do negative damage.

Anyways, that depends how you want to define trolling. If I want to build AD Donger, then I am allowed to build AD Donger.
